member.name: T:ComponentPro.AsyncEventArgs
member.summary: Represents an asynchronous EventArgs that has members to determine whether it's raised by an asynchronous operation and get the user-defined object.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.AsyncEventArgs.AsyncCall
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the event is raised in an asynchronous call.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.AsyncEventArgs.UserState
member.summary: Gets the user-token specified in an asynchronous call.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the asynchronous method completion events.
member.param: The source of the event.
An that contains event data.
member.typeparam: The type of the result produced by an asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: In .NET 4.5 and higher it's recommended to use async and await modifiers for asynchronous operations.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventArgs`1
member.summary: Provides data for the asynchronous method completion events.
member.typeparam: The type of the result produced by an asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: In .NET 4.5 and higher it's recommended to use async and await modifiers for asynchronous operations.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventArgs`1.Result
member.summary: Gets the asynchronous operation result.

member.summary: Expiry date is invalid.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Licensing.Common.UltimateLicenseExceptionStatus.InvalidVersion

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Licensing.Common.LicenseManager
member.summary: ComponentPro License Manager.

member.summary: Sets the license key.
member.param: The license key string.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Licensing.Common.LicenseManager.RemainingDays
member.summary: Gets the remaining days untill the expiry date.
member.remarks: If the license key is a trial, the software library throws a license exception after that date. For production license, this property just shows the remaning days until the subscription expiry date. The software still works after the subscription expiry date.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType
member.summary: Identifies the type of event that has caused the trace.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.None
member.summary: No log entries.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Critical
member.summary: Fatal error or application crash.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Error
member.summary: Recoverable error.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Warning
member.summary: Noncritical problem.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Information
member.summary: Informational message.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Debug
member.summary: Debugging trace - all messages useful for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceEventType.Verbose
member.summary: Debugging trace and data transfer - log everything.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.ITraceSource
member.summary: Defines a generalized trace source.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.ITraceSource.TraceSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object for all log messages generated by this object. If not set, the property returns the current object.
member.remarks: It is handy to set this property to a different object other than this object in some situation where all log messages should come from a single source. For example, in a build system, uploading files is just a child task of a main one, by assigning this property to the main task, you can categorize all messages that come from the main task.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.ITraceSource.TraceListenerManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the object to which the log messages generated by this object are sent. If not set, the trace listener manager is used. If this property is set to null, all messages from this object wont be logged.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceSourceFilter
member.summary: Represents the simple trace source filter.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceSourceFilter.#ctor(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The source object to compare when a log message is received.
True to ignore log messages comming from the specified source; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.TraceSourceFilter.Matches(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if the input source object is the one that we want to log messages; otherwise false.
member.param: The source object.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Diagnostics.XTrace.SourceFilters
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object filter.
member.remarks: It is handy to add some filters to filter out all messages comming from unwanted sources. For example, in a build system, uploading files is just a child task of a main one. By adding a object to this property, you can show messages coming from the main task only.

member.summary: Writes the indent to the listener you create when you implement this class, and resets the property to false.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes the specified message to the listener you create in the derived class.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a message to the listener you create in the derived class, followed by a line terminator.
